definition: dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose

sentences.english: We must rise above it like a dawn mist on the water.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須凌越悲傷，一如晨露自水面騰昇，依水棲息。

sentences.english: The dew drop fall into dust from the rose petal , without a sign, disappear.
sentences.chinese: 那晨露從玫瑰瓣上滑落塵土，沒有一聲嘆息，消失了。

sentences.english: The sun evaporated the morning dew.
While the youthful hue sits on thy skin like morning dew.
sentences.chinese: 趁青春色澤還像晨露在妳的肌膚停坐之時。

sentences.english: Her happiness vanished like the morning dew.
sentences.chinese: 她的幸福像晨露一樣消失了。

sentences.english: And the death-dews sleep on the morass.
sentences.chinese: 凝冷的晨露躺在沼澤陷阱。

sentences.english: The sun evaborated the morning dew.
Morning dews glitter in the sun.
Researchers have puzzled out how spider silk is able to catch the morning dew.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員近日解開了蜘蛛絲粘着晨露的謎團。

sentences.english: All day in the morning dew in false Mr Lau ward, sent to all sorts of nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 於晨露整天泡在“假劉達”的病房，送去各種營養品。

sentences.english: And earth, which fades like dew!

definition: morning dew/fig. precarious brevity of human life/ephemeral
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
first rays of morning sun/first glimmer of dawn
Hanlu or Cold Dew, 17th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd October
autumn frost/fig. white hair as sign of old age
